InputPins.Name: a
InputPins.Tooltip:
Value that should be split into components.
Can be of any type, missing components output zero.

OutputPins.Name: x
OutputPins.Tooltip: Returns the x component of the incoming data.

OutputPins.Name: y
OutputPins.Tooltip: Returns the y component of the incoming data. Zero if the incoming data has less than 2 components.

OutputPins.Name: z
OutputPins.Tooltip: Returns the z component of the incoming data. Zero if the incoming data has less than 3 components.

OutputPins.Name: w
OutputPins.Tooltip: Returns the w component of the incoming data. Zero if the incoming data has less than 4 components.

InputPins.Name: x
InputPins.Tooltip: The first component of the incoming data is put into the x component of the output.

InputPins.Name: y
InputPins.Tooltip: The first component of the incoming data is put into the y component of the output.

OutputPins.Name: result
OutputPins.Tooltip: The first component of each input is put into the respective component of the output.

InputPins.Name: y
InputPins.Tooltip: The first component of the incoming data is put into the y component of the output.

InputPins.Name: z
InputPins.Tooltip: The first component of the incoming data is put into the z component of the output.

OutputPins.Name: result
OutputPins.Tooltip: The first component of each input is put into the respective component of the output.
